title: Getting started with dialvalidator
text: dialvalidator parses, validates, formats, classifies phone numbers using Google’s libphonenumber metadata. covers 240+ territories requires Java runtime.

title: Getting started with dialvalidator
text: Numbers can supplied international format (leading +) national format default_region:
code: # International format — region is inferred phone_parse("+64211234567") #> [[1]] #> [[1]]$raw #> [1] "+64211234567" #>  #> [[1]]$country_code #> [1] "64" #>  #> [[1]]$national_number #> [1] "211234567" #>  #> [[1]]$region #> [1] "NZ" #>  #> [[1]]$valid #> [1] TRUE  # National format — supply the region phone_parse("021 123 4567", default_region = "NZ") #> [[1]] #> [[1]]$raw #> [1] "021 123 4567" #>  #> [[1]]$country_code #> [1] "64" #>  #> [[1]]$national_number #> [1] "211234567" #>  #> [[1]]$region #> [1] "NZ" #>  #> [[1]]$valid #> [1] TRUE

title: Getting started with dialvalidator
text: phone_valid() returns logical vector:
code: phone_valid(c("+64211234567", "+6421", "not a number")) #> [1]  TRUE FALSE FALSE

what: Phone Number Validation Using Googles libphonenumber' Metadata
title: Phone Number Validation Using Googles libphonenumber' Metadata
text: Phone number validation R using Google’s libphonenumber metadata. Java required.

title: Phone Number Validation Using Googles libphonenumber' Metadata
Phone Number Validation Using Googles libphonenumber' Metadata
code: library(dialvalidator)  # Validate phone_valid("+64211234567") #> TRUE  # Format phone_format("+64211234567", "NATIONAL") #> "021 123 4567"  phone_format("+64211234567", "INTERNATIONAL") #> "+64 21 123 4567"  # Detect type and country phone_type("+64211234567") #> "mobile"  phone_country("+64211234567") #> "NZ"  # National format with default region phone_valid("021 123 4567", default_region = "NZ") #> TRUE  # All-in-one phone_info(c("+64211234567", "+12125551234")) #>            raw         e164       national   international region country_code   type valid #> 1 +64211234567 +64211234567   021 123 4567 +64 21 123 4567     NZ           64 mobile  TRUE #> 2 +12125551234 +12125551234 (212) 555-1234 +1 212-555-1234     US            1 ...    TRUE

title: Phone Number Validation Using Googles libphonenumber' Metadata
text: functions vectorised: pass character vector, get vector (data frame) back.

title: Phone Number Validation Using Googles libphonenumber' Metadata
text: package ships pre-parsed metadata libphonenumber covering 240+ territories. update latest upstream metadata: downloads current PhoneNumberMetadata.xml, parses , caches result tools::R_user_dir("dialvalidator", "cache"). internet access needed install time normal use.

title: Phone Number Validation Using Googles libphonenumber' Metadata
text: package uses metadata Google’s libphonenumber project, licensed Apache License 2.0. Java code included.

title: Phone Number Validation Using Googles libphonenumber' Metadata
text: Apache License 2.0

what: dialvalidator: Phone Number Validation Using Google's 'libphonenumber' Metadata — dialvalidator-package
title: dialvalidator: Phone Number Validation Using Google's 'libphonenumber' Metadata — dialvalidator-package
text: Parses, validates, formats, classifies phone numbers using Google's 'libphonenumber' metadata. Covers 240+ territories support mobile, landline, toll-free, number types. Unlike 'dialr', package requires Java runtime — metadata pre-parsed upstream 'PhoneNumberMetadata.xml' shipped bundled R object. Functions accept character vectors return simple R types (logical, character, data.frame).

title: dialvalidator: Phone Number Validation Using Google's 'libphonenumber' Metadata — dialvalidator-package
text: Maintainer: Peeyoosh Chandra pc@strategyandops.co

what: Get the full metadata object — dv_metadata
title: Get the full metadata object — dv_metadata
text: Returns parsed libphonenumber metadata used internally validation functions. Useful inspection debugging.

title: Get the full metadata object — dv_metadata
Get the full metadata object — dv_metadata
text: list elements cc_to_regions, territories, example_numbers, version, built.

title: Get the full metadata object — dv_metadata

what: Get metadata for a specific territory — dv_territory
title: Get metadata for a specific territory — dv_territory
text: Get metadata specific territory

title: Get metadata for a specific territory — dv_territory
Get metadata for a specific territory — dv_territory
text: region ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 region code (e.g., "NZ", "US").

title: Get metadata for a specific territory — dv_territory
text: list containing territory's country code, national prefix, phone type patterns, formatting rules, example numbers. Returns NULL region found.

title: Get metadata for a specific territory — dv_territory
Update metadata from upstream — dv_update_metadata
text: Downloads latest PhoneNumberMetadata.xml Google's libphonenumber repository, parses , saves result user's cache directory. updated metadata used remainder session.

title: Update metadata from upstream — dv_update_metadata
text: url URL raw PhoneNumberMetadata.xml file. Defaults master branch GitHub.

title: Update metadata from upstream — dv_update_metadata
text: Invisibly returns path cached metadata file.

title: Update metadata from upstream — dv_update_metadata
text: Requires xml2 package.

title: Access Phone Number Metadata — metadata
text: Functions access update bundled libphonenumber metadata.

what: Detect Country of a Phone Number — phone_country
title: Detect Country of a Phone Number — phone_country
text: Returns ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 region code phone number.

title: Detect Country of a Phone Number — phone_country
Detect Country of a Phone Number — phone_country
text: number Character vector phone numbers. default_region ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 region code numbers national format. See phone_parse() details.

title: Detect Country of a Phone Number — phone_country
text: Character vector region codes (e.g., "NZ", "US"). Returns NA numbers parsed.

title: Detect Country of a Phone Number — phone_country
Format Phone Numbers — phone_format
text: Formats phone numbers according standard conventions.

title: Format Phone Numbers — phone_format
code: phone_format(   number,   format = c("E164", "NATIONAL", "INTERNATIONAL"),   default_region = NULL )

title: Format Phone Numbers — phone_format
text: number Character vector phone numbers. format One "E164" (default), "NATIONAL", "INTERNATIONAL". E164 +64211234567 — compact international format spaces. NATIONAL 021 123 4567 — local dialling format national prefix. INTERNATIONAL +64 21 123 4567 — international format spaces. default_region ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 region code numbers national format. See phone_parse() details.

title: Format Phone Numbers — phone_format
text: Character vector formatted numbers. Returns NA numbers parsed.

what: Get All Phone Number Information — phone_info
title: Get All Phone Number Information — phone_info
text: Parses, validates, formats, classifies phone numbers single call. Returns data frame one row per input number.

title: Get All Phone Number Information — phone_info
Get All Phone Number Information — phone_info
text: number Character vector phone numbers. default_region ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 region code numbers national format. See phone_parse() details.

title: Get All Phone Number Information — phone_info
text: data frame columns: raw Original input. e164 E.164 formatted number. national National format. international International format. region ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 region code. country_code Country calling code. type Number type (mobile, fixed_line, etc.). valid Logical validation result.

title: Get All Phone Number Information — phone_info
code: phone_info("+64211234567") #>            raw         e164     national   international region country_code #> 1 +64211234567 +64211234567 021 123 4567 +64 21 123 4567     NZ           64 #>     type valid #> 1 mobile  TRUE phone_info(c("+64211234567", "+12125551234")) #>            raw         e164       national   international region country_code #> 1 +64211234567 +64211234567   021 123 4567 +64 21 123 4567     NZ           64 #> 2 +12125551234 +12125551234 (212) 555-1234 +1 212-555-1234     US            1 #>                   type valid #> 1               mobile  TRUE #> 2 fixed_line_or_mobile  TRUE

title: Parse a Phone Number — phone_parse
text: Parses phone number string components: country code, national number, region. Numbers can provided international format (leading +) national format (default_region).

title: Parse a Phone Number — phone_parse
text: number Character vector phone numbers. default_region ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 region code (e.g., "NZ", "US") used numbers national format (leading +). NULL, numbers without + prefix fail parse.

title: Parse a Phone Number — phone_parse
text: list parsed phone number lists, elements: raw original input string. country_code Country calling code (e.g., "64" NZ). national_number national significant number (digits ). region ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 region code. valid Logical indicating number valid. Returns list valid = FALSE numbers parsed.

title: Detect Phone Number Type — phone_type
text: Classifies phone numbers mobile, fixed-line, toll-free, etc. matching libphonenumber's per-territory type patterns.

title: Detect Phone Number Type — phone_type
text: number Character vector phone numbers. default_region ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 region code numbers national format. See phone_parse() details.

title: Detect Phone Number Type — phone_type
text: Character vector phone number types. Possible values: "mobile", "fixed_line", "fixed_line_or_mobile", "toll_free", "premium_rate", "shared_cost", "personal_number", "voip", "pager", "uan", "voicemail", "unknown". Returns NA numbers parsed.

title: Validate Phone Numbers — phone_valid
text: Checks whether phone numbers valid according libphonenumber's metadata. number valid parses successfully, valid length, matches general number pattern region.

title: Validate Phone Numbers — phone_valid
text: number Character vector phone numbers. default_region ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 region code numbers national format. See phone_parse() details.

title: Validate Phone Numbers — phone_valid
text: Logical vector. TRUE valid numbers, FALSE otherwise. NA inputs return FALSE.

title: Validate Phone Numbers — phone_valid
code: phone_valid("+64211234567") #> [1] TRUE phone_valid(c("+64211234567", "+6421", "not a number")) #> [1]  TRUE FALSE FALSE phone_valid("021 123 4567", default_region = "NZ") #> [1] TRUE
